featured.text: Some critics have said that MOOCs promote an unrealistic one-size-fits-all model of higher education and that there is no replacement for true dialogues between professors and their students.

In addition to traditional course materials such as videos, readings, and problem sets, MOOCs provide interactive user forums that help build a community for the students, professors, and teaching assistants.

MOOCs first made waves in the fall of 2011, when Professor Sebastian Thrun from Stanford University opened his graduate-level artificial intelligence course up to any student anywhere, and 160,000 students in more than 190 countries signed up.
Perhaps the most striking thing about MOOCs, many of which are being taught by professors at prestigious universities, is that they’re free.

other.text: There is a lot of excitement and fear surrounding MOOCs.

Which of the following is NOT one of the features of MOOCs?
Which of the following is a problem of MOOCs mentioned in the passage? (A)

definition.zh_def: 大規模開放在線課程，通常由大學或教育機構提供，允許大量學生免費或以低成本參加。
definition.en_def: A massive open online course that allows unlimited participation and is accessible to anyone with an internet connection, often offered by universities or educational institutions.
definition.example: She enrolled in a MOOC to learn about artificial intelligence.
